comments:
I recently updated to CDT 3.0, but I am receiving the following error when I try
to create a new managed make project.  I have tried starting over with a fresh
workspace and deleting my .eclipse directory.  I also tried re-installing
eclipse and getting CDT 3.0 again so that no old version remained in my plugins
directory, but I am still unable to create a managed make project.

java.lang.NullPointerException

Thanks,
Stephanie

I started over with completely fresh workspaces and eclipse and downloaded the
CDT tar.gz file instead of using the update site this time.  I am now able to
create new managed make projects in my workspace, but I still receive the same
error when trying to create new managed make projects in the runtime workspace.
 I am using eclipse 3.1, CDT 3.0.0 and White Box Linux 3.

Thanks,
Stephanie

I finally was able to create projects in the runtime workbench.  Before updating
CDT, I was launching the runtime workbench with only required plug-ins and all
CDT plugins.  After updating, I was attempting to use the same launch profile,
but it was not loading all of the CDT plugins and I did not realize it.  Now,
after launching the runtime workbench with all CDT plugins, I am able to use all
CDT functionality.

Thanks,
Stephanie
